docs.lead_paragraph: A new Census Bureau measure denotes households pulled out of poverty by benefits or closer to it by certain expenses, and a count suggests they are far more numerous than previously understood.

headline.seo: ‘Near Poor’: Not Quite in Poverty, but Still Struggling
headline.main: Older, Suburban and Struggling, ‘Near Poor’ Startle the Census
headline.print_headline: Older, Suburban and Struggling, ‘Near Poor’ Startle the Census

docs.abstract: Census Bureau's fuller measure of poverty finds that greater number of 'near-poor' Americans live closer to poverty line than was previously understood; while skeptics warn that new measure overstates level of hardship, most economists embrace findings, saying they comport with what was previously known about stagnant wages.
docs.snippet: A new Census Bureau measure denotes households pulled out of poverty by benefits or closer to it by certain expenses, and a count suggests they are far more numerous than previously understood.

byline.original: By JASON DePARLE, ROBERT GEBELOFF and SABRINA TAVERNISE

docs.lead_paragraph: Mary Dunn, who is legally blind and suffers from spinal stenosis, taught herself how to use a computer she found in the garbage.

headline.main: A Computer Brings the World to a Reclusive Woman
headline.print_headline: A Computer Brings the World to a Reclusive Woman

docs.abstract: Federation of Protestant Welfare Agencies helps Mary Dunn of Hell's Kitchen neighborhood of Manhattan buy a computer monitor.

docs.lead_paragraph: The agency said the drug “has not been shown to be safe and effective” for breast cancer patients, but would remain available for treating other types of cancer.

headline.main: F.D.A. Revokes Approval of Avastin for Use as Breast Cancer Drug
headline.print_headline: F.D.A. Revokes Approval of Avastin for Use as Breast Cancer Drug

docs.abstract: Food and Drug Administration commissioner Dr Margaret A Hamburg revokes approval of Genentech drug Avastin as a treatment for breast cancer; cites clinical trials that have shown that drug was not effective and exposed patients to serious side effects; Avastin will remain available for treating other types of cancer and doctors can use it off-label to treat breast cancer, but insurers might not pay for it.
docs.snippet: The agency said the drug “has not been shown to be safe and effective” for breast cancer patients, but would remain available for treating other types of cancer.

headline.main: Supreme Court Names Two Lawyers to Argue Points in Health Care Law

docs.abstract: H. Bartow Farr III and Robert A. Long will submit briefs as friends of the court, and participate in the marathon arguments likely to take place in March.
docs.snippet: H. Bartow Farr III and Robert A. Long will submit briefs as friends of the court, and participate in the marathon arguments likely to take place in March.

docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON -- The Supreme Court on Friday made two prominent Washington lawyers very happy and very busy, appointing them to argue on behalf of positions that neither side in the challenges to the 2010 health care law has chosen to embrace.

headline.main: Supreme Court Names Two Lawyers to Argue Points in Health Care Law

docs.abstract: The justices added lawyers to address the issues of whether the individual mandate can be severed from the rest of the law, and whether the appeals under way are premature.
docs.snippet: The justices added lawyers to address the issues of whether the individual mandate can be severed from the rest of the law, and whether the appeals under way are premature.

docs.lead_paragraph: Newt Gingrich’s work for health care companies has raised questions about the intersection of the Republican candidate’s consultancies and policy positions.

headline.seo: Newt Gingrich Faces More Scrutiny on Corporate Clients
headline.main: Gingrich Faces More Scrutiny Over Corporate Clients
headline.print_headline: Gingrich Faces More Scrutiny on Corporate Clients

docs.abstract: Republican presidential candidate Newt Gingrich's work for health care companies has raised questions about the intersection of his high-earning consultancies and his public policy positions; the focus on Gingrich's business dealings is posing one of his biggest challenges and threatens his efforts to campaign as an outsider with pristine conservative credentials.
docs.snippet: Newt Gingrich’s work for health care companies has raised questions about the intersection of the Republican candidate’s consultancies and policy positions.

docs.lead_paragraph: C-Span should be allowed to televise the oral arguments of the landmark case challenging the health care law. It’s too important.

headline.seo: Supreme Court Coverage of the Health Care Case

docs.abstract: Editorial holds that C-Span should be allowed to televise arguments before Supreme Court in landmark case challenging the health care law; says for a case this important, the justices would serve the public and the court by allowing cameras in.
